I usually listen to meditation tapes or go for walks, like I mentioned last time. Great! One technique we could try is mindfulness meditation. Have you ever practiced mindfulness before? Mindfulness involves focusing on the present moment without judgment. It can help reduce anxiety. Would you like to try a brief mindfulness exercise together? Alright, let’s take a moment to focus on our breath. Inhale deeply through your nose… hold it for a moment… and exhale slowly through your mouth. Let’s do that a few times together. Good. As you breathe, try to notice any sensations in your body. If thoughts come to mind, acknowledge them and gently bring your focus back to your breath. Maybe journaling? I’ve thought about writing down my thoughts and feelings. I’ve thought about creating a small ritual, like lighting a candle and reflecting on the good times.

I could set aside a few minutes each day to just breathe and focus. That’s common. It can be helpful to set a specific time each day or week to write. Would you like to set a goal for your journaling practice? I could aim for writing once a week, maybe on Sundays. That sounds like a beautiful way to honor the past while also allowing yourself to heal. Would you like to try that for the next week? That’s a good idea.
